Synopsis: 
After hundreds of years of conflict, the human race has defeated his most terrifying enemy, the hordes of vampires. The few remaining vampires have been held in isolated reserves, and most humans have taken refuge in walled cities run by the Church. The priests, trained as deadly fighters during the wars against the vampires, now perform menial jobs, live in complete isolation and marked by their distinctive tattoos, are shunned by the locals. 

When news of a vampire attack and the kidnapping of a 18 year old in a remote area reaches the ears of a priest (Paul Bettany), a veteran, this ruling monsignors requests permission to go for the hostage his niece. When they refuse, breaks his sacred vows, defies the orders of his superiors and sets out to find the girl before the enslaved vampires. In cross joins her niece's boyfriend, Hicks (Cam Gigandet), a young sheriff and a trigger-happy old warrior priestess (Maggie Q) who has supernatural fighting powers. 

But when they reach the desert town of Jericho, Priest, Priestess Hicks and found a scene of devastation that bears the mark of the vampire and with it a new and frightening threat. 

Production notes: 
- Adaptation of the comic TokyoPop, to be released in 3D.
